name: cardiac valve
aka: heart valve; valve of heart
description: A membranous fold of the heart that prevents reflux of fluid.

name: heart
aka: chambered heart; vertebrate heart
description: A myogenic muscular circulatory organ found in the vertebrate cardiovascular system composed of chambers of cardiac muscle. It is the primary circulatory organ.

name: coronary artery
aka: coronary arterial tree
description: An artery that supplies the myocardium.

name: right coronary artery
description: Coronary artery which runs along the right side of the heart and predominantly supplies the mycocardium of the right side of the heart[Wikipedia,modified].

name: left coronary artery
description: Coronary artery which runs along the left side of the heart and predominantly supplies the mycocardium of the left side of the heart[Wikipedia,modified].

name: right cardiac atrium
aka: cardiac right atrium; heart right atrium; right atrium; right atrium of heart; right cardiac atrium
description: A cardiac atrium that is in the right side of the heart. It receives deoxygenated blood. In mammals, this comes from the superior and inferior vena cava and the coronary sinus, and pumps it into the right ventricle through the tricuspid valve.

name: left cardiac atrium
aka: cardiac left atrium; heart left atrium; left atrium; left atrium of heart; left cardiac atrium; atrium sinistrum
description: A cardiac atrium that is in the left side of the heart. It receives oxygenated blood from the pulmonary veins, In mammals this is pumped into the left ventricle, via the Mitral valve.

name: heart right ventricle
aka: cardiac right ventricle; right ventricle; right ventricle of heart
description: A cardiac ventricle that is in the right side of the heart.

name: cardiac atrium
aka: atrium; atria; atrium of heart; cardiac atria; heart atrium
description: Cardiac chamber in which blood enters the heart.

name: cardiac ventricle
aka: heart ventricle; lower chamber of heart; ventricle of heart
description: Cardiac chamber through which blood leaves the heart.

name: heart left ventricle
aka: cardiac left ventricle; left cardiac ventricle; left ventricle; left ventricle of heart
description: A cardiac ventricle that is in the left side of the heart.

name: interventricular septum
aka: heart interventricular septum; heart ventricular septum
description: Cardiac septum which separates the right ventricle from the left ventricle.[FMA].

name: cardiac septum
aka: cardiac septa; heart septa; heart septum; septum of heart
description: The thin membranous structure between the two heart atria or the thick muscular structure between the two heart ventricles.

name: atrioventricular valve
aka: AV valve
description: A cardial valve in the atrioventricular region that separates the atrium from the ventricle and prevent backflow from the ventricles into the atria during systole.

name: tricuspid valve
aka: right atrioventricular valve; valva atrioventricularis dextra
description: An atrioventricular valve that is part of the outflow part of the right atrium.

name: mitral valve
aka: left atrioventricular valve; valva atrioventricularis sinistra
description: An atrioventricular valve that is part of the outflow part of the left atrium.

name: aortic valve
description: Cardiac valve which has as its parts the anterior, right posterior and left posterior cusps, attached to the fibrous ring of aortic valve.[FMA].

name: pulmonary valve
aka: pulmonic valve
description: The semilunar valve of the heart that lies between the right ventricle and the pulmonary artery.

name: epicardium
aka: heart epicardium; visceral serous pericardium of heart; visceral serous pericardium proper
description: A region of the serous membrane that forms the innermost layer of the pericardium and the outer surface of the heart.

name: sinoatrial node
aka: cardiac pacemaker; Koch's node; node of Keith-Flack; nodus sinuatrialis; SA nodal muscle tissue; SA node; sinoatrial node; sinu-atrial node; sinuatrial nodal muscle tissue; sinuatrial node; sinus node; sinus node of Keith and Flack
description: The part of the cardiac conduction system that controls the timing of heart muscle contraction. It relays electrical signals to the AV node[GO]. Subdivision of conducting system of heart at the junction of the right atrium and the superior vena cava, around the sinoatrial nodal branch of right coronary artery and is continuous with the internodal tract[FMA].

name: atrioventricular node
aka: Aschoff-Tawara node; atrioventricular nodal muscle tissue; AV nodal muscle tissue; AV node; node of Tawara; nodus atrioventricularis
description: An area of conducting tissue between the atria and the ventricles of the heart that conducts the normal electrical impulse from the atria to the ventricles.

name: bundle of His
aka: atrio-ventricular bundle; atrioventricular bundle; atrioventricular bundle muscle tissue; atrioventricular fasciculus; AV bundle; AVB; bundle of His; fasciculus atrioventricularis; His bundle
description: A part of the His-Purkinje system that transmits signals from the AV node to the cardiac Purkinje fibers[GO].

name: papillary muscle of heart
aka: papillary muscle; papillary muscle of ventricle; ventricular papillary muscle; ventricule papillary muscle
description: One of the group of myocardial bundles which terminate in the chordae tendineae that attach to the cusps of the atrioventricular valves; each ventricle has an anterior and a posterior papillary muscle; the right ventricle sometimes has a septal papillary muscle.

name: cardiac muscle of right atrium
aka: cardiac muscle of cardiac right atrium; cardiac muscle of heart right atrium; cardiac muscle tissue of heart right atrium; cardiac muscle tissue of right atrium; cardiac muscle tissue of right atrium of heart; myocardium of right atrium; right atrium heart muscle; right atrium myocardium; textus muscularis of myocardium of right atrium; textus muscularis of myocardium of right atrium of heart; textus muscularis of myocardium of right cardiac atrium
description: A portion of cardiac muscle tissue that is part of a right atrium [Automatically generated definition].

name: cardiac muscle tissue of interventricular septum
aka: cardiac muscle of interventricular septum; cardiac muscle tissue of interventricular septum; interventricular septum cardiac muscle; interventricular septum heart muscle; interventricular septum myocardium
description: A portion of cardiac muscle tissue that is part of an interventricular septum [Automatically generated definition].

name: heart blood vessel
aka: blood vessel of heart
description: A blood vessel that is part of a heart [Automatically generated definition].

name: outflow tract
aka: cardiac outflow tract; heart outflow tract
description: The outflow tract is the portion of the heart through which blood flows into the arteries.

name: cardiac vein
aka: coronary vein; cardiac vein; heart vein; vein of heart
description: Vein of heart that drains the myocardium.

name: cardiac chamber
aka: chamber of heart; heart chamber
description: A cardiac chamber surrounds an enclosed cavity within the heart.

name: right atrium valve
aka: valve of right atrium
description: A valve that is part of a right atrium [Automatically generated definition].

name: outflow tract of ventricle
aka: heart ventricle outflow tract; outflow part of ventricle; ventricular outflow tract
description: A ventricular outflow tract is a portion of either the left ventricle or right ventricle of the heart through which blood passes in order to enter the great arteries. The right ventricular outflow tract (RVOT) is an infundibular extension of the ventricular cavity which connects to the pulmonary artery. The left ventricular outflow tract (LVOT), which connects to the aorta, is nearly indistinguishable from the rest of the ventricle[WP].

name: coronary sinus
aka: sinus coronarius
description: The short trunk that recieves most of the cardiac veins carrying the blood from the myocardium and delivers it to the right atrium, with the sinoatrial connection occurring between the inferior vena cava and the atrioventricular orifice.

name: semi-lunar valve
aka: semilunar valve; semilunar valves
description: The valves that gate the flow of blood from the ventricles into the aorta and pulmonary trunk.

name: outflow tract of atrium
aka: outflow part of atrium
description: An outflow tract that is part of a cardiac atrium.

name: outflow part of left ventricle
aka: aortic vestibule; heart left ventricle outflow tract; left ventricular outflow; left ventricular outflow tract; LVOT; outflow tract of left ventricle; Sibson vestibule; vestibulum aortae
description: Anterosuperior fibrous portion of the left ventricle that connects to the ascending aorta.

name: outflow part of right atrium
aka: main part of right atrium; outflow tract of right atrium
description: Outflow part of atrium which consists of wall and cavity of the outflow part of right atrium and the tricuspid valve.[FMA].

name: outflow part of left atrium
aka: main part of left atrium; outflow tract of left atrium
description: An outflow tract of atrium that is part of a left atrium.

name: coronary vessel
description: Any of the arteries or veins that supply blood to the heart or return blood from the heart muscles to the circulation.

name: left ventricle myocardium
aka: left ventricular myocardium; myocardium of left ventricle
description: A myocardium that is part of a left ventricle of a heart.

name: right ventricle myocardium
aka: myocardium of right ventricle; right ventricular myocardium
description: A myocardium that is part of a right ventricle of a heart.

name: great vein of heart
aka: great cardiac vein
description: The Great Cardiac Vein (left coronary vein) begins at the apex of the heart and ascends along the anterior longitudinal sulcus to the base of the ventricles. It then curves to the left in the coronary sulcus, and reaching the back of the heart, opens into the left extremity of the coronary sinus. It receives tributaries from the left atrium and from both ventricles: one, the left marginal vein, is of considerable size, and ascends along the left margin of the heart.

name: middle cardiac vein
aka: lesser cardiac vein; posterior interventricular vein
description: The middle cardiac vein commences at the apex of the heart, ascends in the posterior longitudinal sulcus, and ends in the coronary sinus near its right extremity.

name: atrioventricular region
description: An anatomical junction that divides and overlaps with and atrium and a ventricle in the heart.

name: heart vasculature
aka: cardiac vasculature
description: An interconnected tubular multi-tissue structure that contains fluid that is actively transported around the heart.

name: small cardiac vein
aka: right cardiac vein
description: A vein running parallel to the right coronary artery in the coronary sulcus that drains into the right extremity of the coronary sinus.

name: circumflex branch of left coronary artery
aka: circumflex coronary artery; left circumflex branch of left coronary artery; ramus circumflexus (arteria coronaria sinistra)
description: Branch of left coronary artery which runs perpendicular to the anterior interventricular branch of the left coronary artery on the left side of the interventricular sulcus and supplies the left side of the heart.

name: left cardiac chamber
description: Any chamber of the left side of the heart.

name: right cardiac chamber
description: Any chamber of the right side of the heart.
